newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine grains, oilseeds mixed on weather worry.
newsitem.headline: Argentine grains, oilseeds mixed on weather worry.

text.p: Argentine cash grains and soybeans weakened in thin trade on the Buenos Aires Cereals Exchange Tuesday, with improved weather forecasts in the United States triggering selling by funds, dealers said.

Spot wheat was unchanged while new crop fell $1-2 a tonne. Spot and new maize weakened $1-1/2 a tonne and soybean dived $3-5 a tonne. But there was support for sunseed from short supply and spot sunseed prices rose $1.
